newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares fall, 2,100 support seen tested.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares fall, 2,100 support seen tested.

text.p: Lack of confidence in the Singapore share market pushed stocks to close lower on Tuesday.
"There has been more or less across the board selling of index stocks," said an institutional dealer.
"Funds are just not confident that Singapores shares can perform better than alternative markets," he said.
Dealers said selling hit over the counter stocks and second liners as well.
The 30-share Straits Times Industrials Index lost 10.62 points to 2,116.04. Market turnover was slight at 76.96 million shares with losers outweighing gainers by 225 to 80.
Funds perferred to invest in Malaysia or Hong Kong markets for the time being, dealers said.
They said they expected the STII to test support at 2,100 this week. "Even if that level holds, there is not much upside in Singapore," said a dealer at a Japanese securities firm.

DBS Land topped the actives with 3.7 million shares and fell Singapore $0.08 to S$4.44. It saw 345,000 shares crossed at various prices. Another property counter City Development rose S$0.20 to S$11. "Views on the property sector is mixed," said a dealer.--JOSEPHINE NG (65-8703094)
